    • Method Detail

      • authorizeRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean authorizeRequest(DAO sql,
                                               SwimRequestBean swimReqBean,
                                               java.lang.String authorizationAlias,
                                               java.lang.String permission,
                                               java.lang.String operator)
                                        throws BackendException
        The method authorize a request. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. Depending by the permission given, some fields of the request are mandatory. If the permission belongs to a user access change (or admin user access change) process: applicant and beneficiary codes are mandatory. If the permission belongs to a delegation access change (or admin delegation access change) process: applicant, beneficiary and delegant codes are mandatory. In these two cases, it should also be provided at least one or more of the three possible lists of roles (to add, to remove or to change). It is important to know that the roles to add could have some rights to valorize, in this case these rights have to be valorized and put into the corresponding roles before to associate them to the request bean. If the permission belongs to an account change process: applicant and beneficiary codes are mandatory. In this case it should also be provided at least one or more of three possible lists of accounts (to lock, to unlock or to reset). It is important to know that the name field must be valorized and, in case of account lock, it is mandatory also to valorize the block field to configurate correctly the account. If the permission belongs to an entity change process: applicant code is mandatory.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        swimReqBean - request to authorize, applicant code is always mandatory, beneficiary code is generally mandatory
        authorizationAlias - the authorization alias
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        request approved
        Throws:
        BackendException - the backend exception if permission is null or not refers to a correct workflow. If authorizationAlias is null

      • rejectRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean rejectRequest(DAO sql,
                                            SwimRequestBean swimReqBean,
                                            java.lang.String authorizationAlias,
                                            java.lang.String permission,
                                            java.lang.String operator)
                                     throws BackendException
        The method reject a request. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. Depending by the permission given, some fields of the request are mandatory. If the permission belongs to a user access change (or admin user access change) process: applicant and beneficiary codes are mandatory. If the permission belongs to a delegation access change (or admin delegation access change) process: applicant, beneficiary and delegant codes are mandatory. In these two cases, it should also be provided at least one or more of the three possible lists of roles (to add, to remove or to change). It is important to know that the roles to add could have some rights to valorize, in this case these rights have to be valorized and put into the corresponding roles before to associate them to the request bean. If the permission belongs to an account change process: applicant and beneficiary codes are mandatory. In this case it should also be provided at least one or more of three possible lists of accounts (to lock, to unlock or to reset). It is important to know that the name field must be valorized and, in case of account lock, it is mandatory also to valorize the block field to configurate correctly the account. If the permission belongs to an entity change process: applicant code is mandatory.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        swimReqBean - request to reject, applicant code is always mandatory, beneficiary code is generally mandatory
        authorizationAlias - the authorization alias
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        request rejected
        Throws:
        BackendException - the backend exception if permission is null or not refers to a correct workflow. If authorizationAlias is null
